channel.title: Hmm how would i do this, copy a cd
channel.description:
ok i got some movies from blockbusters how do i copy them? so when i return them i can still watch them
i know its a noob question but w/e
Thanks,
Mvp566

item.title: Hmm how would i do this, copy a cd
item.dc:creator: @kaza Kaza
item.description:
@kaza wrote:

If you want to burn a dvd, put your dvd in the top drive, blank disk in the bottom one, open your burning program (i use NeroStartSmart) and then click burn, wait till its done and you now have 2 dvds ^^.

Read full topic

item.title: Hmm how would i do this, copy a cd
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

I do this for my brothers Video iPod. If you want to do that, get the trial version of This. It works without the full version fine, I forgot the crack I used to get the full version though. Just google it, I’m sure you will find something.

Read full topic
item.source: Hmm how would i do this, copy a cd

item.title: Hmm how would i do this, copy a cd
item.dc:creator: @DeadBird DeadBird
item.description:
@DeadBird wrote:

DVD Decrypter + AutoGK is usually what I do.
If you have a DivX capable DVD player, its much easier to have it fit on a single layer DVD that way you can use your TV.

Read full topic
item.source: Hmm how would i do this, copy a cd

item.title: Hmm how would i do this, copy a cd
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Depends what you want to rip it to. You can use something like DVD Decrypter to copy the dvd-format vob files to your HD and then use DVDShrink to reduce the quality/remove features to allow it to fit onto a 4.7gb dvd. You can also use something like AutoGK (simplified version of the Gordian Knot) to compress a dvd down to 700mb or 1.4gb avi files.

Read full topic
